headline.main: THE SUMMER SEASON.; Observations, Adventures and Reflections of the Times Correspondent at Saratoga.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sixty years ago, a hunting party awoke the drowsy echoes in the sylvan shades of this quiet Saratoga. The sun was lapsing into another world, and pale Gynthia already shone in the rich robe of the parting day. The dogs were athirst,

headline.main: CANADA.; The Falls of the St. Maurice.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: In the search after novelty, which animates the pedestrian in this traveling age, I intend marking out a route, which he can pursue with advantage, particularly if he be a lover of the picturesque or what is beautiful in Nature.

headline.main: WILLIAMSBURG CITY.; DEATH OF A MINISTER. DIVIDEND.-

docs.lead_paragraph: Judge EDMONDS, on Saturday, dissolved the injunction previously issued to prevent the proper Department from signing the contract with Russ and REID, for paving Chathamstreet and the Bowery.
docs.snippet: Judge EDMONDS, on Saturday, dissolved the injunction previously issued to prevent the proper Department from signing the contract with Russ and REID, for paving Chathamstreet and the Bowery.

headline.main: The Boys of Randall's Island--Banner Presentation.
THE SUMMER SEASON.; Observations, Adventures and Reflections of the Times Correspondent at Saratoga.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was teen quite warm to-day, as much so as it is likely to be in this shady nook of the world. The immense court-yard of the United States Hotel is, as you are aware, planted with a magnificent growth of forest trees. They are certainly the finest of the neighborhood. Indeed I have not seen any elsewhere at all approaching them in richness of foliage, and general beauty of growth.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctor CHAPMAN, (says the Philadelphia North American, of Friday,) an eminent physician and excellent man, died at his residence in Philadelphia, yesterday afternoon, at 6 o'clock. He had reached an advanced age, and for the last few years was rapidly declining in health.

docs.lead_paragraph: Judge EDMONDS, on Saturday, dissolved the injunction previously issued to prevent the proper Department from signing the contract with Russ and REID, for paving Chathamstreet and the Bowery. The ordinance authorizing the work, it will be remembered, was vetoed by the Mayor, and afterwards passed in spite of the veto, by the Common Council.
